GPS Simulator

Built for UC Davis' computer simulations in STEM education freshman seminar.

View on GitHub

GPS Simulator

GPS.m is a MATLAB script that defines a function GPS(target) target: vector of [x y z] coordinates to test the accuracy of the solver against

When run, the script simulates a time step and evaluates the positions of 4 satellites and estimates the position of the target. A graph is plotted of the target and the satellites in 3D, and diagnostic information is printed to the console.

Kepler Solver

kepler_orbit.m is a script that defines a function kepler_orbit(period,a,b)

The script plots four graphs taken from the solution of the kepler equation along fixed timesteps for one period of orbit

This project was developed in a UC Davis Seminar, Computer Simulations for STEM education

GPSsimulation is maintained by klanmiko. This page was generated by GitHub Pages.
